definition: trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
The Sound and the Fury (novel by William Faulkner 威廉·福克納|威廉·福克纳[Wei1 lian2 · Fu2 ke4 na4])

sentences.english: Since ancient times, many colorful banditry commotions more unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 自古边关多匪患，骚动年代更空前。

sentences.english: His words caused a stir among the audience.
sentences.chinese: 埃德斯坦说，这席话在观众中引起了一阵骚动。

sentences.english: My attention was led away by the disturbance in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上的骚动转移了我的注意力。
听众笑了起来发出一阵骚动。

sentences.english: Q. There are some social unrests recently caused by pollution. What do you think?
sentences.chinese: 最近有一些由污染引起的社会骚动。您怎么看？

sentences.english: Loud voices and a renewed uproar were raised in front of the boarding-house.
sentences.chinese: 寄宿公寓前又发出声声叫喊，出现了新的骚动。

sentences.english: The brouhaha is the latest development in a nearly two-decade row.
sentences.chinese: 这次的骚动是这个接近二十年争议的最新延续。

sentences.english: A militant attitude often betrays an inner turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 好战的姿态常常显露了内心的骚动。

sentences.english: President Widodo has blamed "political actors" for taking advantage of the furore.
sentences.chinese: 总统佐科谴责某些政治人物在利用这次公众骚动。

sentences.english: The theft of the jade vase caused much excitement.
sentences.chinese: 玉瓶的失窃引起很大的骚动。

sentences.english: The whole community was astir when the news came.
sentences.chinese: 消息传来，整个社区都骚动起来。

sentences.english: We often use it to describe some uproarious festivities.
sentences.chinese: 我们通常用它来形容一些骚动的庆典。

sentences.english: With the wind Piaowu snow on me, and gone with the wind of youth unrest.
sentences.chinese: 随风飘舞的雪花，于我，随风而逝的青春骚动。

sentences.english: This is the unavoidable fate that is doomed upon Faulker's characters.
sentences.chinese: 这就是《喧嚣与骚动》中人物的命运。

sentences.english: The recent Microsoft brouhaha over paid editing is the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 最近关于微软有偿编辑的骚动就是冰山一角。

definition: to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
to whisper to one another's ear
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
